context: The word 'jään' is the first person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'jääma', which means 'to stay'. It can refer to remaining in a place or continuing an activity. The verb has different forms depending on the subject and tense - for example, 'ta jääb' (he/she stays) in third person singular present, and 'me jäame' (we will stay) in first person plural future tense.
